meanings.definition: The act of screening or evaluating something in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prescreenings of job applicants helped the company find the best candidates.
meanings.sent2: Before the movie started, they conducted prescreenings to ensure the audience's enjoyment.
meanings.sent3: The prescreenings of the new video game revealed some unexpected glitches.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous prescreenings of potential tenants saved her from troublesome renters.
meanings.sent5: The prescreenings of the contestants brought out the most talented performers.

meanings.definition: The process of examining or inspecting something beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The prescreenings of the documents helped catch any errors before submission.
meanings.sent2: The prescreenings of the equipment ensured safety measures were in place.
meanings.sent3: The prescreenings of the food samples made the lab technician feel like a detective.
meanings.sent4: His thorough prescreenings of the project plan prevented any major setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The prescreenings of the merchandise revealed hidden defects.
